Interface GameView

All Known Implementing Classes:
HexagoView, SquareView
public sealed interface GameView permits HexagoView, SquareView
The `GameView` interface defines methods for rendering game elements on the screen, interacting with the graphical interface, and managing visual feedback for the player. Implementations include support for both hexagonal and square views of the game.

  • Method Details

    • drawBoard

      void drawBoard(Graphics2D graphics, Player player)
      Draws the game board for the specified player.
      Parameters:
      graphics - the Graphics2D object used for rendering graphical elements on the screen.
      player - the player for who we draw the board

    • drawShelf

      void drawShelf(Graphics2D graphics, Shelf shelf)
      Draws the shelf containing tiles and tokens.
      Parameters:
      graphics - The Graphics2D context used for rendering.
      shelf - The shelf to draw.

    • getCoupleFromScreen

      Position getCoupleFromScreen(int x, int y)
      Converts screen coordinates into logical shelf coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate on the screen.
      y - The y-coordinate on the screen.
      Returns:
      The logical position on the shelf corresponding to the screen coordinates.

    • fromScreenToRealCoordinates

      Position fromScreenToRealCoordinates(int x, int y, Board board)
      Converts screen coordinates into logical board coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate on the screen.
      y - The y-coordinate on the screen.
      board - The game board.
      Returns:
      The logical position on the board corresponding to the screen coordinates.

    • displayMessage

      default void displayMessage(com.github.forax.zen.ApplicationContext context, String message, Color color, int x, int y, int size)
      Displays a custom message on the screen in the specified color and position.
      Parameters:
      context - The application context for rendering.
      message - The message to display.
      color - The color of the message text.
      x - The x-coordinate of the message.
      y - The y-coordinate of the message.
      size - The font size of the message.

    • drawEndScreen

      default void drawEndScreen(com.github.forax.zen.ApplicationContext context, List<Player> players)
      Displays the end screen with final scores for all players.
      Parameters:
      context - The application context for rendering.
      players - The list of players to display scores for.

    • draw

      default void draw(com.github.forax.zen.ApplicationContext context, Shelf shelf, Player player, ControllerGraphic game)
      Draws the game screen including the board and shelf for the specified player.
      Parameters:
      context - The application context for rendering.
      shelf - The shelf to render.
      player - The player whose board and shelf are displayed.
      game - The controller managing the game's graphical logic.
